content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the placebo effect?

choices.label: Dr. Kennedy observed that if people expected a treatment to work, it would, even if the patient received a fake treatment.
Dr. Tyler observed that people taking antipsychotic medication improved their quality of life more than those who did not take medication.
Dr. Adams helped his clients uncover unconscious feelings about their childhood trauma, which helped them become better adjusted to stress.
Dr. Lincoln used active listening to help clients sense and perceive the world better.

content.answer: Dr. Kennedy observed that if people expected a treatment to work, it would, even if the patient received a fake treatment.
